They also include restrictions on the sale of 10 or more rented units in a development (the “Tyrrelstown amendments”).We are currently updating the relevant documents on citizensinformation.ie with these and other recent changes

Your main legal rights and responsibilities as a private tenant derive from landlord and tenant law as well as from any lease or tenancy agreement between you and your landlord

Ní féidir léasanna nó comhaontuithe tionóntachta eile baint de do chearta faoi Acht na dTionóntachtaí Cónaithe 2004. Is féidir leatsa agus do thiarna talún aontú ar ábhair nach bpléitear leo san Acht, ámh

The main legislation governing these rights and obligations is contained in the Landlord and Tenant Acts 1967 to 1994, the Residential Tenancies Act 2004 and the Residential Tenancies (Amendment) Act 2015

Níl feidhm ag forálacha an Achta um Thionóntachtaí Cónaithe ach amháin le tithíocht phríomhshrutha ar cíos, faoi láthair, cé go mbeartaítear sa Bhille um Thionóntachtaí Cónaithe (Leasú) (Uimhir 2), 2012 (pdf) chun go leor tionóntachtaí a rialú san earnáil tithíochta deonaí ar an mbealach céanna a dhéantar i gcás tionóntachtaí príobháideacha
However, if you are renting a room in your landlord's home you are not covered by landlord and tenant legislation (though you are covered if you rent a self-contained flat in your landlord’s home)
Clúdaítear tionóntaí tithíochta sóisialta agus tionóntaí príobháideacha a chónaíonn i dteach a dtiarna talún (mar shampla, faoin Scéim Seomra ar Cíos) ag dlíthe éagsúla
Leases or other tenancy agreements cannot take away from your rights under the legislation, but you and your landlord can agree on matters that are not dealt with in it
Is féidir leat teacht ar bhreis faisnéise faoi chearta agus dualgais do thiarna talún

Cearta mar thionónta i gcóiríocht phríobháideach ar cíos
Rights as a tenant
• Tá tú i dteideal taitneamh ciúin eisiach a bhaint as do chóiríocht
• You are entitled to quiet and exclusive enjoyment of your home
• Tá tú i dteideal íoschaighdeáin áirithe cóiríochta
• You are entitled to a rent book
• Tá tú i dteideal leabhar cíosa
• You have the right to contact the landlord or their agent at any reasonable times
• Tá an ceart agat dul i dteagmháil leis an tiarna talún nó lena ngníomhaire ag amanta réasúnta
You are also entitled to have appropriate contact information (telephone numbers, email addresses, postal addresses, etc.)
Tá tú i dteideal an eolas teagmhála cuí a theastaíonn uait chuige sin freisin (uimhreacha gutháin, seoltaí ríomhphoist, seoltaí gnáthphoist, srl.)
• Your landlord is only allowed to enter your home with your permission
• Ní cheadaítear do do thiarna talún dul isteach i do chóiríocht ach le do cheadsa amháin
If the landlord needs to carry out repairs or inspect the premises, it should be by prior arrangement, except in an emergency
Má theastaíonn ón tiarna talún deisiúcháin a dhéanamh nó an t-áitreabh a scrúdú, ba cheart go ndéanfaí socrúcháin roimh ré, ach amháin i gcás éigeandála
• You are entitled to reimbursement for any repairs that you carry out that are the landlord's responsibility
• Tá tú i dteideal cúitimh as aon deisiúcháin a déanann tú arb iad cúram an tiarna talún iad
• You are entitled to have visitors to stay overnight or for short periods, unless specifically forbidden in your tenancy agreement
• Tá tú i dteideal cairde a óstáil thar oíche nó ar feadh achar gairid, mura dtoirmeasctar go sonrach sin i do chomhaontú tionóntachta
You must tell your landlord if you have an extra person moving in
Ní foláir duit insint do do thiarna talún faoi aon duine breise a théann a chónaí sa teach
• You are entitled to a certain amount of notice of the termination of your tenancy
• Tá tú i dteideal méid áirithe fógra um chríochnú do thionóntachta
• You are entitled to refer any disputes to the Residential Tenancies Board (RTB) without being penalised for doing so
• Tá an teidlíocht agat aon díospóidí a tharchur chuig an mBord um Thionóntachtaí Cónaithe Príobháideacha (BTCP) gan aon phionós as a leithéid de ghníomh
• You have the right to a copy of any register entry held by the RTB dealing with your tenancy
• Tá an ceart agat do chóip d’aon iontráil i gclár i seilbh an BTCP a phléann do thionóntacht
• All homes for rent must have a Building Energy Rating (BER), stating how energy-efficient the home is
• Ní mór go mbeidh ag gach teach atá ar cíos Rátáil Fuinnimh Foirgnimh (BER), a luann a éifeachtúla atá an teach i dtaobh fuinnimh de
This will help you to make an informed choice when comparing properties to rent
Cabhróidh seo leat chun rogha eolach a dhéanamh nuair a bhíonn réadmhaoin á gcur i gcomparáid le cíos
• The landlord’s right to terminate a Part 4 tenancy for the reason that they require the dwelling for their own or family member occupation does not apply to AHB tenancies
Tá an ceart ar dhaingneacht tionachta agat i dtimthriallta ceithre bliana faoi Chuid 4 den Acht um Thionóntachtaí Cónaitheacha 2004

These provisions are in Part 4 of the Residential Tenancies Act 2004, so a tenancy that is in existence for more than 6 months is known as a Part 4 tenancy. All tenancies are deemed to end after 4 years
Tugtar tionóntacht den Chuid 4 ar thionóntacht ar a ndéantar ráthaíocht sa dóigh seo
If you continue to be the tenant at the end of the 4 years, you have a Further Part 4 tenancy. You may stay in the property but you are considered to have a new tenancy
Má tá sé ar intinn agat leas a bhaint as cosaint faoi Chuid 4 den Acht um Thionóntachtaí Cónaitheacha 2004 (m.sh

If you intend to stay in the property, you should inform your landlord in writing between 3 months and 1 month before the expiry of your fixed-term tenancy or lease agreement. This right to remain is subject to certain rights that the landlord continues to have

Obligations of a tenant
• Do chíos a íoc in am
• Pay your rent on time
• Dea-slacht a choinneáil ar an maoin

• Pay any other charges that are specified in the letting agreement, for example, waste collection charges; utility bills; management fees to the management company in an apartment complex – see ‘Other charges and payments’ below • Keep the property in good order
• A insint don tiarna talún má theastaíonn deisiúcháin agus rochtain a thabhairt don tiarna talún ar an maoin chun deisiúcháin a dhéanamh
• Inform the landlord if repairs are needed and give the landlord access to the property to carry out repairs
• Ligean don tiarna talún (trí choinne) teacht isteach chun ghnáthscrúduithe a dhéanamh
• Give the landlord access (by appointment) for routine inspections
• An tiarna talún a chur ar an eolas faoi na daoine a chónaíonn sa mhaoin
• Avoid causing damage or nuisance
• Dochar agus núis a sheachaint
• Comply with any special terms in your tenancy agreement, oral or written
• A dhéanamh cinnte nach cúis le briseadh an dlí ag an tiarna talún tú
• Give the landlord the information required to register with the RTB and sign the registration form when asked to do so
• Cloí le haon téarmaí speisialta i gcomhaontú do thionóntachta, bíodh sé scríofa nó i bhfoirm béil
• Give the landlord proper notice when you are ending the tenancy
• An t-eolas a thabhairt don tiarna talún ar riachtanach é chun clárú leis an BTCP agus an fhoirm chlárúcháin a shíniú nuair a iarrtar ort amhlaidh
You should note that it may be more difficult to assert your rights if you have broken conditions of your tenancy
• A insint don tiarna talún roimh an mí deiridh de thionóntacht théarma seasta ar mó ná sé mhí í má tá sé ar intinn agat cosaint faoi Chuid 4 d'Acht na dTionóntachtaí Cónaithe 2004 a fháil (m.sh
Other charges and payments
fanacht sa mhaoin ar feadh cheithre bliana)
As the tenant of a property, you are the occupier and are responsible for paying the water charges
Ba chóir duit tabhairt faoi deara go mb’fhéidir go mbeadh sé níba dheacra do chearta a mhaíomh má bhris tú coinníollacha do thionóntachta
In practice, if you are renting a house, you are likely to be liable for all these charges
Tionóntachtaí príobháideacha agus glacadóireacht
In some multi-unit developments, such as apartment complexes, the heating may be operated centrally and you may not have to pay separately for it

Má tá morgáiste do thiarna talún i riaráistí agus má cheap an t-iasachtóir morgáiste glacadóir, ní mór duit an cíos a íoc leis an nglacadóir, ach is é an tiarna talún a bhíonn freagrach go dlíthiúil, go fóill, as ceisteanna ar nós d’éarlaisí a thabhairt ar ais
In some complexes, cable TV may be supplied. In most complexes, bin collection is organised by the management company and you may not have to pay charges for this

Féadfaidh an glacadóir socruithe a dhéanamh go ndéanfar deisiúcháin, ach bíonn sé doiléir maidir le cibé acu an gá nó nach gá don ghlacadóir é seo a dhéanamh nó cibé acu an nglacann nó nach nglacann an glacadóir aon cheann d’fhreagrachtaí tiarna talún air/uirthi féin
Your landlord may pass these charges on to you if this is agreed, but if they are not paid, the owners’ management company may pursue the owner (the landlord) for them
Tá athruithe féideartha ar an dlí á bhfiosrú chun breis soiléireachta a sholáthar do thionóntaí príobháideacha a bhfuil a dtithe á gcur faoi ghlacadóireacht
The receiver may arrange for repairs to be carried out, but it is unclear whether the receiver is required to do this or whether the receiver takes on any of the responsibilities of a landlord
Má chónaíonn do thiarna talún lasmuigh den Stát, ní mór duit cáin a asbhaint den chíos agus í a chur i gcuntas do na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
If you pay income tax and you were already renting on 7 December 2010, you may be eligible for some tax relief on the rent
Má íocann tú cáin ioncaim, agus má bhí cíos á íoc agat cheana féin an 7 Nollaig 2010, d’fhéadfá bheith i dteideal roinnt faoiseamh cánach a fháil ar an gcíos
If your landlord lives outside the State, you must deduct tax for the rent and account for it to the Revenue Commissioners
Is féidir leat níos mó a léamh inár gcáipéis ar shaincheisteanna cánach do thionóntaí
These include taking your case to the Residential Tenancies Board, which provides a dispute resolution service for both private and AHB tenancies
Má bhraitheann tú go bhfuiltear ag sárú do chearta mar thionónta, is amhlaidh a bhíonn roinnt modhanna sásaimh agat
Threshold provides a free advice and information service to tenants - see 'Where to apply' below – and has published a leaflet on resolving problems during your tenancy (pdf)
Déanann ár ndoiciméad ar dhíospóidí a réiteach cur síos ar cad is féidir leat a dhéanamh
If your landlord is not maintaining the property to the proper standards you can contact your local authority, which is responsible for enforcing standards in rented housing
Soláthraíonn Threshold faisnéis agus comhairle saor in aisce do dhaoine le fadhbanna tithíochta

The RTB has published a Good Tenant Guide, a brief summary of common issues. It has also published a checklist for tenants on how to prevent disputes and a similar checklist for landlords. The FLAC (Free Legal Advice Centres) website has a leaflet (pdf) on the basic rights and duties of landlords and tenants
